original: Connective tissues are fibrous structures composed of cells dispersed within an inorganic substance known as the extracellular matrix. Often referred to as fascia, derived from the Latin term "fascia," meaning "band" or "bandage," connective tissues provide shape to organs and help maintain their position within the body.
